product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Glorified Webcam
body: I bought the Furbo as a birthday gift for my boyfriend who is absolutely obsessed with his dog. I figured we were getting a screaming deal since I bought it on Prime Day 2018 for an "unheard of price" (according to Furbo) of $199 – $100 off. The price has now fluctuated within a few dollars of $199 since Prime Day in July. I digress. Regardless, we were both super jazzed that we could check in on the pup, talk to him AND toss him a few treats. Now, having had it for a few months, we can honestly say that it wasn't really worth the money – here's why. You might be able to see your pup, but the video quality is quite grainy and on par with a 90's webcam which is largely disappointing. The sound detection of barking is pretty spot on; however, the mic volume is very poor, so my dog can't hear me when I tune in to the Furbo, making it a very impractical feature. We do really enjoy the treat dispenser function (definite plus). Understandably, the treat dispenser is only meant to hold a particular, round treat, so that never bugged me, but I know bugs others who use very specific treats with their pets. Our biggest frustration with the Furbo, however, is the notifications we now have to pay extra for (what Furbo now calls the Dog Nanny). Previously a free feature, notifications like when your dog is being active (or for many of us, when your dog is getting into things s/he shouldn't), now come at a additional monthly subscription fee. Our two cents? Save your money, skip the Furbo and opt for a webcam.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Furbo made miracle happen for me
body: I’ve been using furbo for 2.5 weeks now. It has done so much for me!! I have a maltipoo who has been having to stay at my parents’ place when I moved out because when I tried to keep him at my small apartment, he barks all day long cuz he gets bored out of his mind when I’m at work all day. I couldn’t keep him at my place cuz neighbours started to complain and the strata manager even gave me warnings about how he has to call SPCA if it continues. It took my baby about a week to adjust to furbo. He was barking at it everytime I tried to interact with him through it in the first week. I only gave him treats through furbo when I see that he is quiet and has calmed down. The next week he was surprisingly adjusting to it very well, barely barked and I could talk to him through furbo and give him treats without him barking at all! I was so proud of him!! Hopefully in the next weeks to come he will continue to behave and I can continue to keep him at my place with the help of furbo!The only small issue I had with furbo was the time on the screen was incorrect even though I had selected the right time zone (which was resolved really quickly with great customer service by email). Just for your information, the treat dispenser always dispenses 2-3 treats at a time instead of just one which I wasn’t expecting. I bought one of the recommended treats on their site which was Dog for Dog mini treats. Another thing is be careful where you aim the treats, they don’t always shoot out into the exact same spot so if it goes under a furniture, your dog will not forget, it will bark at it until the treat grows legs and comes walking out on its own (in the dogs mind) since my apartment is small, I can’t place furbo where ever I want to to avoid it being tossed under furniture. I’ve placed obstructions like cardboard boxes under the furniture to avoid it from rolling in.But regardless, these things are minor to me because what furbo has done for me is so much greater in comparison to them!Because of furbo, I can actually keep my baby with me everyday and see him every time I come home from work!————-— Update —————-I’ve been using furbo for over half a year now and I still recommend the product. I am just updating you in some glitches that I’ve encountered since using furbo.Over the months there has been some updates on furbo’s system and I’ve found that the camera lags more often after the updates so I’ve had to switch to the lowest resolution now and then. Some days, the in and out of the audio is malfunctioning so it will not notify me if my dog was barking. When that happens, if I don’t unplug and replug furbo, it will continue to malfunction. It’s happened to me about 4 times since I’ve had furbo.I have faith that furbo will improve on these things just because of their great customer service and that is why I still recommend furbo :)———————Update————————I’ve been using Furbo for about a year and a half now and I’ve still been recommending this product to people just because of how grateful I am of what furbo has given me. I came across another review that the mic feature is very poor as I was showing a friend of mine this product on amazon. I just want to say I personally think this feature is decent. From time to time I actually talk to my boyfriend and dog at home when I’m out using furbo so quality of the sound is not an issue for us. My dog has never not heard me whenever I called for him on furbo. He always comes running when he hears me on furbo because he thinks he might be getting a treat!Lastly, the furbo “nanny” feature (with bonus features of intruder alert, selfie alert and your dog being active alert etc) has always been a bonus feature. There was a period in time when everyone got a free trial of the furbo nanny and had a choice if they wanted to proceed with paying monthly for the special features. I simply ignored it and they’re not charging me any fees for it. I am happy with their barking alert, mic and treat toss features.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: I paid for a cool concept, not a functional product
body: I had REALLY high hopes for this product since the concept seemed to be interesting and useful. When setting it up it took a few tries for it to start connected to our wifi, which isn't a big deal on it's own, trying to use it for a few days on the other hand just adds to the frustration of the product. The concept of paying for the nanny aspect in the future is baffling to me, since the product retails for $299. The camera quality is bad even in good lighting, the live stream is very choppy, delayed, and the app keeps telling me to low the video quality from 720p--- my internet is more than qualified to handle this product. The app either glitches and closes or just flat out refuses to play any 10 sec clips to sends me a notification for. Half of my attempted uses involve the app not even allowing me to view in real time due to an error that closing completely, restarting or uninstalling/reinstalling doesn't fix.When it does 'work' and I get to view my dogs being 'active', it's never when he gets up or plays, its always as hes jumping back onto the sofa to lay down. Last night I had 15 notifications/10 sec clips of my one dog laying down... out of 4 animals that are always in that one room that's all it captured? Hardly worth hundreds of dollars.I'm not sure how anyone could endorse such a pricey product knowing it could be 90% better.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: 5/5 Super fun, amazing dog camera
body: Amazing purchase!! I love being able to check in on my dog and cat when I'm not home, and they love getting treats when we're not home. The set up was super easy and I had no issues connecting to the Furbo my wifi or to the app on my phone (total process took 5-10 minutes), and the power cord is quite long which is super useful if you want to place the Furbo somewhere that isn't right beside an outlet. I used training treats for the Furbo that I had at home (I think most training treats would work as they tend to be smaller) and it's super fun. He got more treats than usual the first night because it was so much fun tossing the treats and seeing him wait by the Furbo. I'm going to have to ease up on this, lest he becomes too chunky...I've attached some pictures during the day and at night and as you can see, the video quality is great. So far the cat hasn't been quick enough to get any treats since the dog is so fast (sidenote: the only time the dog is fast is when food is involved), but maybe one day... All in all, 5/5 stars!

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: There are better alternatives!
body: The Furbo definitely works, but not well. The camera quality is great but the the real kicker is that you can’t use it. When the camera is on the highest quality setting the “live” footage is trash, it’s super choppy. The only way to get fluent footage is for the Furbo to be on the lowest camera quality setting.I could almost stand by this product if it wasn’t for the price, 300$ is ridiculous. A way better alternative to this is an app called “cloud baby monitor” which is roughly 6$ and is a one time purchase and has no hidden fees (this app is intended to be used on babies but works for this purpose). I open the app on my iPad and leave it at home with the dog and open the app on my iPhone wherever I happen to be and watch him. Sure the app can’t lauch treats at your dog, save footage or has nightvision but if you leave the a light on and leave your dog with a Kong here is no difference. Also on the app you can get sent noise and motion alterts and choose the sensitivity, this replaces bark alterts. The app also has two way talk and can play lullabies.

title: Horrible

If you have a dog with separation anxiety like I do, and want  to be notified so you can check on them or talk them down from a freak out, don’t bother with this camera. product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Beware of "unknown" subscription fee and inability to delete video
body: I love the unit, which is certainly expensive enough.  Two issues: be prepared for a monthly subscription fee to use the motion detection, which the unit is basically useless without, and video cannot be deleted by the user (stored in Furbo's cloud). If the camera happens to catch you walking around naked, for example, you can't delete the video. It'll stick around in the "doggy diary" for a week!!The premium subscription fee has not yet been finalized so it's free for 90 days... After that time, which is conveniently after the return date (!!), the fee will be charged... But we don't know how much it'll be.  They think between $5-10/month.  It is NOT worth $300 plus $120/year.

title: Good, not great
body: I bought this for my dog who is only alone 2 work days a week, who started a bad habit of howling and barking. Living in an apartment I had to try to change that behavior. Unfortunately, the Furbo had zero effect on my dogs barking. My dog likes getting food throughout the day, but that's about it. My dog is smart enough to understand that even though he is hearing my voice and getting food, i'm not actually there. The positives about this is that while I'm out and about I know that he has something to keep him a little busy and I like knowing what he up to so I'm less worried about him. The device does what it says (gives treats ect.), but has it's limitations and has no affect on my dogs separation anxiety, i'v had it for 2 months now.

title: 200$ for a 20$ camera
body: Honestly, do not buy this. It's a waste of money.- First of all, it's 200$ upfront but then none of the features advertised are free - they want you to get a subscription.- Second, the camera quality is horrid, and worse than those cheap IP cameras you can get for under 20$ (you can at least remotely rotate those cameras).- Lastly, It doesn't toss treats very well, even though I'm using the treats they recommend.So what does Furbo do successfully? Nothing.Use that 200$ on better food for your dog or pay a more important bill with it, and get a 20$ camera on Amazon to see your dog when you're out, but I truly hope you don't spend it on this.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Cheap build and malfunctions quickly
body: Bought the Furbo only 2 months ago and it worked for the first month and now no longer gives us barking alerts (which are still set to on) and has a habit of refusing to connect so that we can check on the dogs while out. Before you say it’s a network issue, all of our other smart home devices still connect. The sole reason we bought the Furbo was because we live in a busy apartment building and wanted to ensure our dogs aren’t barking when we are out — it has literally stopped providing any sort of assistance with that. It appears to be cheaply built as well.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Works easily, great images...
body: I love this! I love seeing what my dog is doing! There's nothing about this camera I would change... Set-up and the app are easy, the quality of the camera images is wonderful (being able to zoom in is a bonus), talking and being able to toss a treat is great... It's heavy enough to be stable on a surface, and it looks good sitting out...I like that you can change the quality of the video (360p,720p,1080p), that there are options for night vision (on, off, automatic), and that you can choose if you want to be notified when your dog barks... There's a Smart Dog Alert option that's free right now (they don't say when that will stop or how much it will be), that will alert you when it detects a person, detects your dog being active, and will take a 'selfie' when your dog looks into the camera... I didn't find those feature particularly useful or interesting - dog activating is probably the best of the three, and am happy with the camera without them...

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: I LOVE THIS!!!!!
body: I put off buying this because of the price, but I’m SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS. I cannot describe how much I love this thing. I work very long days and I worry a lot about my two little puppies, especially as one has pretty good separation anxiety and howls like crazy when I leave. I love being able to get notifications when my little guys are kicking up a fuss and being able to do something about it right away. I was feeling pretty helpless wondering if they were annoying the neighbors etc. With Furbo I can correct their barking right away and help them feel less anxious. It’s a huge load off my mind!Video quality is good. I love being able to take screen shots and videos of what my babies get up to. I love that I can switch to night time mode. The treat dispenser works pretty reliably. I did jam it with treat dust once, but that was my fault since they tell you not to use those sorts of crumbly treats. I got it working again in a few minutes though. Seriously, watching this thing spit treats out on the camera is so funny. Sound on the mic is good, notifications work reliably. I’ve been using it pretty heavily since I got it a few days ago and no problems so far.Will update if something happens since no one wants to drop a bunch of money on something that breaks right away.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Mostly good news for now.
body: Video quality was a bit iffy at first but seems to have improved after a few minutes of being connected. Product seems to work well and has some really cool features. Voice is not full duplex and the volume seems to fluctuate and cut in and out a little even with 150Mbps internet. I strongly dislike that the app forces you to review their product and really dislike the idea that this product may evolve into a subscription service. If that ever happens, I'll no longer be using it.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: I do not recommend it.
body: I bought the Furbo on prime day, and I have been using this since I received it. I really wanted to love this product, but I have to say that the experience is not really good. First, the video quality is below my expectation. If I switch to the highest quality, then I will no longer have smooth video streaming, and it come with annoying buffering. The video is only watchable when the camera quality is on “lowest.” Second, the performance of microphone is unacceptable. My dog can barely hear me when he is not close enough to Furbo. I also tested serval times and I can say the microphone is not have any functional at all. Third, I do not think the product deserve their users to pay for their monthly subscription fee. Some basic features are not supposed to include in subscription plan.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Not worth the hype...
body: I bought my Furbo about a month ago. I had issues with my first Furbo that arrived - the lid broke after 3 days and sometimes the treats wouldn't dispense (It wouldn't work to throw it or even to get a treat). I called Furbo about it and they sent a replacement right away, so that's good.I always have issues with the app. It always crashes and I have to restart it at least 2-3 times in order for it to load the camera. It's really frustrating when I get a notification of my dog barking (I got noise complaints from neighbours), and it takes me 5-10 minutes of restarting the app several times in order for my Furbo camera to connect. Also, the app crashes frequently.The description also advertises about motion alerts. My dog or cat can be running around like crazy in my home, but I don't get any notification of action. Furthermore, it also doesn't alert you of any movement caused by someone walking by it - I have a dog sitter come by and she walks right by my Furbo and spends some time inside my home... I don't get any kind of notification! Camera quality is mediocre, nothing amazing.I only got the Furbo because of the barking alert which I needed, due to noise complaints. Aside from that, sometimes the treats don't throw properly, app is always crashing, other alerts like motion don't work, etc... And this is from my first and second Furbo.A lot of money for this thing when it doesn't do half of its duties.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Fantastic purchase but minor bugs
body: This thing is so great!! Our Bernese mix dog suffers from separation anxiety and unfortunately does not do well being crated. We’ve let her free roam the house but found that she is very destructive towards our furniture and belongings. This camera is truly a godsend for us. I love that we are able to check in on her to see what she’s up to throughout the day and it’s also great that we can speak to her and toss her treats so she doesn’t get too anxious/bored which leads to her destructiveness.The night vision setting is also very handy as well and I feel like it’s a definite bonus to have.Reason I’m only giving it 4 stars is because the app itself absolutely drains my phone battery like no ones business (although this might just be an issue with my phone) and I do have trouble sometimes syncing with the camera when I do pull up the camera on the app - sometimes it takes forever to connect.All in all a great purchase! product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: The best thing I ever bought for me and my dog!
body: I am a person who is so bonded to my golden retriever I worry about him all the time while I’m at work. I’m always wondering if he’s happy or sad while I’m away. This FUrbo machine is so amazing! It has reduced a lot of my anxiety about leaving him home alone. I now know that he’s sleeping beside my couch or he’s waiting at the door for me. I also know when someone is at my door or when my friend comes over to play with him. I can check on him at any time. I will advise you though please don’t make the mistake I made. Don’t use the microphone to talk with your pet. My fur baby searched everywhere for me and was crying/ barking for me. He thought I was hiding somewhere at home and it actually really stressed him out. So now I only use this device/ machine/ app to watch and observe how his day is. Also, the treat dispenser completely freaks him out and scares him. It shoots treats across the room which I thought was really cool! My dog runs away and then comes back and growls at it and then hides. So I don’t use that at all. The best things about FUrbo is 1.) I know everything about my dogs day and how much activity he needs when I’m home. 2.) I know if anyone comes over or goes to my back door. 3.) I know if my dog is barking. 4.) it takes really awesome 10 second videos of my dog and his day. I LOVE that! I would buy this again as it was worth every cent!!! I show everyone and tell everyone how it works. If I were rich I would buy one for everyone I know that has a dog. Amazing!!!! The set up was so easy as well! Nothing complicated.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: Sub-par product, worse service
body: Ok, ive finally gotten frustrated for the last time with this thing and yes i am going to waste 5 minutes of my time writing an angry review because this product has wasted several hours of my time. First things first... Not worth the money they charge, at all. The camera quality is decent, the wifi stream is adequate but sometimes glitchy or laggy (and i have fibe with 50mbps in my home, so i am certain it is not my internet connection). The treat tossing works about 75% of the time, the 25% is when theres a stream interruption which happens alot or the mechanism gets blocked by my treats which are smaller than the size recommend to work properly with the machine. The next problem is with the audio quality and microphone... I have never, ever, been able to clearly talk into my smartphone and have the audio come out clearly on the device itself. The audio is always choppy and broken, and id be lucky if i could even get a sentence to be clearly heard on the other end. The audio quality of the stream is also very poor as i can barely hear the radio i always leave on for my dog and its literally a couple meters away. The biggest downfall of this device is that it does not swivel, it only sits in one spot and does have a wide angle lens, but it cannot be panned manually from left to right. The other problem with the camera is the color contrast... I have a black dog and burgundy couches, and it takes a trained eye to make out his outline on the couch during broad daylight even with lights on in the house. Want to hear the worst part about this product? Its the service. I bought this device two years ago for my wife on her birthday, because it gives us peace of mind to know our dog is safe while we are at work. Since the begining all of the services the app offered were free, but then all of a sudden about a year ago they started reducing the free features that came with it and started charging for a premium subscription, which i still to this day refuse to pay for. Oh, and whats more, the reason i am writing a frustrated review is because every single time i come back to the app a few days after i last logged in it kicks me out, then i enter my username and password correctly and it tells me the information does not match. this occurs on such a regular basis that its absolutely frustrating that its affected my mental health as well. I can never rely on this product or service to give me the peace of mind to actually know that my dog is safe and sound, and i dont need to worry. Two years after buying, coming from a guy who never writes reviews, there you have it, thats what i think about this inferior product and service. I would have been better off just buying a cheap wireless camera.

title: Brilliant TOOL that is well made. Could use some upgrades, the first retail iteration is brilliant.
body: Firstly, this is a great idea and product. The quality of the packaging makes a customer feel like they are getting value on an item that is actually quite expensive. The touch of wood on the lid was also a touch that exemplifies quality. Also, I was initially concerned at how much of the room the camera would capture and was pleasantly surprised to see that it captured even more than I expected. At the same time, I was a little disappointed that you could not pan around with the camera. Are there positives about the camera would be: good treat capacity , nice streamlined look good quality daytime and nighttime, seems to have the ability to distinguish between different types of behaviours fairly accurately, and finally the ability to communicate with your pet is for sure an asset. On the negative side, we were continuously having problems with connectivity, but for whatever reason it seems to be under control now. Also negatively, it would be nice to be able to vary the arc or distance in which you launch the treats. We have three dogs and as soon as the smartest one figures out where the treats are going he blocks the others from getting a treat. This could be fixed with either the ability to rotate the camera or machine as well as change the arc or the distance that you throw the treat. A small negative also would be for our dogs once they figured out there was treats coming from this machine they attacked it and emptied it. Thankfully we were able to put it on a very high ledge and still managed to capture a good picture.

product: Furbo Dog Camera: Treat Tossing, Full HD WiFi Pet Camera and 2-Way Audio, Designed for Dogs, Compatible with Alexa (As Seen On Ellen)
title: This thing saved my dogs life
body: This thing is worth every penny.Bought it because my very sweet 6 month old husky mix baby girl has decided that she no longer enjoys being in her crate and instead will bark a heck ton while I am away at work. It’s a full detached home but she can be heard barking away by passerby’s, so I figured I’d see what all the fuss is about and try to put an end to whatever is causing the upset.Set it up this morning (super easy, took me two minutes). Put pup in crate and rolled out. Immediately got a bark notification so, in true helicopter mom mode, I turned the video feed on and left it running as I worked away at my desk. Next hour and a half was a constant cycle of barking, pacing, and short naps. Then, she amped up her unhappiness and began tossing her weight around.Important to note, I moved her crate last night; due to some renovations that are happening in the house, her original location no longer works. Moved the crate so it ended up being next to tiling supplies, which are being installed next week. Made sure the bag of grout was upright and out of reach, no big deal.Anyway, turns out that she’s able to move her crate when she’s bumping all 45lbs of her around. Managed to scoot it up to the pile of tiles, on which the bag of grout (the out of reach one) was perched on. I watched in horror as she hit the tile so perfectly that it knocked over the bag of grout. She then stuck her little face far enough through the crate that she could bite the corner of the bag, ripping it open and dumping a considerable pile of powder into her crate.Half a second later I’m running out of the office and racing home (about ten minutes away), yelling at my precious dumb dumb to please stop. She’s very curious, so immediately started trying to figure out where my voice was coming from which distracted her long enough for me to burst through the door of the house.For those that do not know, the cement in grout is extremely corrosive and very very bad for the insides. So we sped our way to the vet where she was promptly treated and will likely make a full recovery. Vomited up an alarming amount of grout and has to take medication for the next week, but she’s basically fine.Here’s what’s up: this all happened around 10am - I get home for lunch at 12:10. If I didn’t have the Furbo and it didn’t work exactly as advertised, I would have arrived home to a dead or dying dog.Get it. It works.

title: The best gift I've ever received!
body: I love my furbo! As someone who works 5 days a week, I often worry about how my dogs are doing when I'm gone. Now I can check on them whenever I like!
